contentrichtext.text: The '''Commonwealth of Britain Bill''' was a [[Bill (proposed law)|bill]] first introduced in 1991 by [[Tony Benn]], then a [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[Member of Parliament]] in the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom]]. It proposed abolishing the [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|British monarchy]], with the [[United Kingdom]] becoming a "democratic, federal and secular commonwealth", in effect, a [[republic]] with a written [[constitution]]. It was read in [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|Parliament]] a number of times until his retirement in 2001, but never achieved a [[second reading]]. Under the bill: *The constitutional status of [[the Crown]] would be ended; *The [[Church of England]] would be [[Disestablishment|disestablished]]; *The [[head of state]] would be the [[President]], elected by a joint sitting of both Houses of the Commonwealth Parliament; *Many functions of the [[Royal Prerogative in the United Kingdom|Royal Prerogative]] would not be transferred to the President, but instead to Parliament; *The [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|Privy Council]] would be abolished, and replaced by a [[Council of State]]; *The [[House of Lords]] would be replaced by an elected [[House of the People]], with equal representation of men and women; *The [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]] would similarly have [[Reverse discrimination|equal]] representation of men and women; *[[England]], [[Scotland]] and [[Wales]] would have their own National Parliaments; *[[County Court]] judges and [[magistrate]]s would be elected; and *British jurisdiction over [[Northern Ireland]] would be ended. ==See also== * [[Republicanism in the United Kingdom]] * [[Common Sense (book)]] ==References== *{{cite |title=Common Sense |last1=Benn|first1=Tony|authorlink1=Tony Benn |last2=Hood|first2=Andrew |editor=Winstone, Ruth |publisher=[[Hutchinson (publisher)|Hutchinson]] |isbn=0-09-177308-3 |date=1993 }} {{wikisource}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Commonwealth Of Britain Bill}} [[Category:1991 in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Republicanism in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Constitution of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Home rule in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Proposed laws of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Tony Benn]] [[Category:1991 in politics]]
